Data: 1.30pm: Disappointingly (but not entirely unexpectedly) a coastal squall has just swept in off the Solent, forcing the groundstaff to wheel on the covers. The toss will be delayed, though hopefully only for 10-15 minutes, with a strong wind ushering the clouds through.
Rankin to Hughes, no run back of a length, over the top of the stumps, Hughes hops back and defends
Rankin to Hughes, no run short and down the leg side, Hughes had gone across his stumps a little way but those are normally called wide...
Rankin to Hughes, 1 run at the body again, tries to flick off the thigh pad and it rolls away for a leg bye behind square
Rankin to Finch, 1 run pitched up outside off for Finch's first ball and he carves a drive through backward point to third man
Rankin to Hughes, no run good pace and carry in the corridor, clocked at nearly 89mph, Hughes goes back and across and lifts his bat out of the way
Rankin to Hughes, no run squared up a little bit, trying to play to leg and a leading edge runs into the covers
Jordan to Finch, FOUR runs pitched up in wide of the stumps, in the slot for a clean hitter like Finch and he bullies Jordan's first ball to the cover boundary
Jordan to Finch, no run full again, driven with a flourish but picks out mid-off
Jordan to Finch, no run length ball, shaping back a touch from wide of the stumps, Finch lets this one through
Jordan to Finch, FOUR runs too wide and floaty again from Jordan and Finch tucks in, plants the front foot and murders another drive through extra cover - the fielders didn't move
Jordan to Finch, no run full and quick, good comeback from Jordan, firing in the yorker and it's only a touchy under 90mph too, well kept out by Finch
Jordan to Finch, no run length ball, driven on the up into the covers
Rankin to Hughes, 1 wide sling this short and down the leg side - called this time
Rankin to Hughes, no run short and attacking the batsman, who again goes back in defence
Rankin to Hughes, no run angled across on a length, gets in line
Rankin to Hughes, 1 run gets on top of the bounce and dabs it into the off side for a quick single
Rankin to Finch, no run this nips back and flips the flap of Finch's front pad, loops through to Buttler and they seemingly appeal for both lbw and caught behind. It is neither
Rankin to Finch, no run beaten on the outside this time, drawn forward into a play and a miss
Rankin to Finch, no run pitched up a little further, angling and hitting Finch on the front pad as he tried to play across the line
Jordan to Hughes, 1 wide back of a length but down leg

Jordan to Hughes, OUT dug in short again, tried tries to pull and Hughes has got a huge top edge - it loops to midwicket and Jordan leaps in the air to celebrate his first England wicket! Think Hughes was beaten for pace, the bottom hand came off the handle and he knew where this was going as soon as he connnected - poor Pippy, it's been a long few months
Jordan to Watson, 1 wide fired past leg stump, Watson misses with an attempted flick
Jordan to Watson, no run stays back and defends as a back-of-a-length ball angles in from outside off
Jordan to Watson, 2 runs touch short, on the body and nudged through square, the fielder has to come round and they get two
Jordan to Watson, no run Watson continues to play back, defends outside off
Jordan to Watson, no run this is fiery stuff from Jordan, pushing above 90mph now and a snorting bouncer has Watson fending the ball away from in front of his throat
Jordan to Watson, 2 runs drifts a little towards leg stump and again clipped through square for two
Rankin to Finch, no run comes across and defends a length ball into the off side
Rankin to Finch, no run slightly fuller length, targeting off stump, Finch gets behind it solidly
Rankin to Finch, no run shorter and straighter, takes the shoulder of the bat as Finch closes the face, drops short on the leg side
Rankin to Finch, FOUR runs well played, Rankin sending down a half-tracker that Finch was ready for, he swivels smoothly and blaps it cross-batted through square to the boundary
Rankin to Finch, no run full of a length, comes forward and punches to mid-off
Rankin to Finch, 1 run length delivery, tapped towards mid-on and they jog through for one
Jordan to Finch, FOUR runs drops short, on Finch's sizeable hips and he nonchalantly paddles it fine of long leg for another boundary
Jordan to Finch, no run on the stumps, worked towards midwicket
Jordan to Finch, no run better length from Jordan, the batsman goes back and across to defend with a straight bat
Jordan to Finch, 1 leg bye works a single off the pads through square
Jordan to Watson, no run length ball angled in on off stump, Watson shows it the maker's name
Jordan to Watson, 1 wide slightly back of a length, again strays down the leg side
Jordan to Watson, no run Watson gets forward to defend a length delivery into the off side
Rankin to Finch, no run very wide but just in side the tramlines, pitching on a good length and bouncing through to Buttler as Finch ignores it
Rankin to Finch, no run closer to off stump, Finch gets in line to defend
Rankin to Finch, no run drops the bat on a fuller ball to keep it out in front of the wicket
Rankin to Finch, no run Rankin continues to test Finch's patience outside off, another solid block from the big fella
Rankin to Finch, no run touch short of a length, climbing in the corridor, defended towards point
Rankin to Finch, no run plays away from the body to a length ball, thickish outside edge falls well short of point - maiden from Rankin
Jordan to Watson, no run outside the line of off, punched with a regal follow through straight to mid-off
Jordan to Watson, FOUR runs goes for some more chin music but Watson knows this tune and kapows a muscular pull high over midwicket and towards the boundary in the bounce
Jordan to Watson, no run even shorter this time, a 90mph bouncer, Watson has to go back and defend up around his jugular
Jordan to Watson, 1 run angling in and worked to leg
Jordan to Finch, no run length delivery on off stump, Finch defends diligently again

Jordan to Finch, FOUR runs Jordan continues to threaten and go for runs in equal measure, this time offering a bit of width and Finch chops it through backward point like a veteran lumberjack, the pace on the ball gives third man Luke Wright no chance of cutting it off
Rankin to Watson, no run goes across his stumps to defend a length ball from the crease
Rankin to Watson, no run length ball, good bounce around the line of off, defended again
Rankin to Watson, 1 run short and stops a little in the pitch, Watson is through the pull a little early and it loops gently behind square
Rankin to Finch, 4 leg byes sliding to the leg side, Finch misses with a flick but it kisses his, er, derriere on the way past and runs to the boundary for extras
Rankin to Finch, FOUR runs short, wide and swatted dismissively over point, buffet ball and Finch gladly helped himself
Rankin to Finch, no run better line and defended back down the track
Stokes to Watson, no run tight line around off, Watson plants the front foot and pushes back towards mid-on
Stokes to Watson, no run little shorter, over the top of the stumps, blocked on the back foot
Stokes to Watson, 1 run outside the line of off, Watson opens the face and guides a length ball past second slip for one

Stokes to Finch, OUT fullish, bit of width and Finch is tempted, doesn't get over a square drive and picks out Morgan first ball after the resumption! Not sure what Finch was thinking there, he surely could have done with a sighter, didn't need to go after that delivery but he's thrown away a promising start and the England players are singing in the post-rain

Stokes to Wade, OUT and he's gloved his first ball behind, a golden duck for Wade! This is quackers, we've had a brief interruption and Australia have come out and lost two in two! Stokes beat Wade for pace with the bouncer, it was a touch leg side, again could have been ignored but the new batsman chased it, clear flick of glove and Stokes has another
Stokes to Clarke, no run doesn't go short, though, length ball shaping back on middle and off, Clarke keeps it out comfortably enough
Rankin to Watson, 1 run short and at the body, Watson, an onlooker during the carnage, works through square
Rankin to Clarke, no run length ball, on off stump, Clarke has edged away towards leg stump but gets in line to defend
Rankin to Clarke, no run continues to pitch it up to Clarke for now, who blocks
Rankin to Clarke, 1 run now drops the ball shorter, paddled securely enough through midwicket for one to get Australia's captain off the mark
Rankin to Watson, 2 runs bit of width, Watson goes deep in the crease and runs the ball off the face of the bat past backward point
Rankin to Watson, 1 run length ball, angled in and nudged through midwicket for another single
Stokes to Watson, 1 run slightly full and in the channel outside off, driven into the ground and it bounces gently towards mid-off, time for a comfortable single

Stokes to Clarke, FOUR runs no foot movement from Clarke as he hacks wildly at a length ball, it flies away through square off the inside edge and although Michael Carberry goes full pelt after it, he's not quite able to pull it in before making contact with the rope
Stokes to Clarke, no run full and around the line of off, bump ball pushed back towards the bowler, who drops it and causes a section of the crowd to groan
Stokes to Clarke, no run short of a length and defended in front of off stump
Stokes to Clarke, no run Clarke throws the bat again, looking a little frantic and slices a drive on the up, the ball dropping short of mid-off
Stokes to Clarke, no run at the body, rising off back of a length, tries to tuck square and gets a gentle leading edge into the on side
Jordan to Watson, no run pitched up and knocked to mid-off on the front foot
Jordan to Watson, 2 runs straighter line, Watson walks across his stumps and glances fine, Rankin does well to prevent a boundary at full stretch
Jordan to Watson, 1 run tailing in and tucked square for one this time
Jordan to Clarke, no run bumper this time, outside off stump, Clarke drops back and gets in line
Jordan to Clarke, FOUR runs short and pulled without a hint of disquiet for a boundary through square leg - you work Clarke over without sustaining a bit of damage yourself
Jordan to Clarke, 1 wide more short stuff, this time sailing down the leg side as Clarke attempts to pull and misses out
Jordan to Clarke, no run good length on off stump, defended on the back foot into the covers
Stokes to Watson, 3 runs full and straight and clipped firmly through midwicket, Jordan makes a sliding stop on the boundary
Stokes to Clarke, FOUR runs pitched up and tailing in, Clarke doesn't need to move too much to crunch this down the ground, it was right under his nose and he placed it fine of mid-off for four
Stokes to Clarke, no run goes across and dabs a length ball towards point
Stokes to Clarke, 1 run dug in, the ball sits up and Clarke swats it through square leg for one
Stokes to Watson, FOUR runs overpitched again by Stokes and Watson on-drives past short midwicket, only came off the toe of his blunderbuss but the ball races to the boundary
Stokes to Watson, no run better length, chopped into the ground towards covers

Jordan to Clarke, no run short and wide and thrashed off the back foot, superbly struck but straight to Stokes at backward point, who has the audacity to throw for the bowler's end and try to run out Watson, too
Jordan to Clarke, no run length ball outside off, Clarke pushes away from his body and an inside edge rolls short on the leg side
Jordan to Clarke, no run tighter from Jordan, Clarke again tries to drive on the up outside off and can't get it away
Jordan to Clarke, 1 leg bye shaping in off a length, an attempted flick rolls off the pads
Jordan to Watson, 1 run waits on a length delivery outside off and cuts into the ground behind point
Jordan to Clarke, 1 wide drifts down the leg side again
Jordan to Clarke, no run good length, on a line around off stump, driven into the ground towards mid-off
Stokes to Watson, FOUR runs too full from Stokes and Watson steps outside off, hits through the line for an authoritative boundary through mid-on
Stokes to Watson, no run comes forward to drive again, this time Stokes gets a boot on it in his follow through
Stokes to Watson, 1 run not quite as full, on the stumps and worked through square
Stokes to Clarke, no run length delivery angled in on off stump, Clarke punches to mid-on
Stokes to Clarke, no run Clarke goes back and across to defend
Stokes to Clarke, no run back of a length, at the batsman's body, blocked into the leg side from the crease
Bopara to Watson, no run full at the stumps, tucked to midwicket
Bopara to Watson, no run length ball on off stump, pushed to cover from the crease
Bopara to Watson, no run fuller on middle and off, swung slightly across it, timed well but only as far as midwicket
Bopara to Watson, 1 run length ball just a touch straight so Watson able to tuck it past midwicket into the deep
Bopara to Clarke, no run slightly loosely driven from off stump to mid-on, wasn't quite the length to drive
Bopara to Clarke, 2 runs touch wide of off stump and dabbed wide of third man, they sprint back for two
Stokes to Watson, no run length on off stump, played on the back foot back to the bowler
Stokes to Watson, FOUR runs too straight and too short, wheeled around the corner and gets four to fine leg, poor ball
Stokes to Watson, 1 run full on the stumps, clipped out to deep midwicket
Stokes to Clarke, SIX runs lovely strike, picked up off a length on off stump and a gorgeous straight drive up and all the way over the rope, delightful timing, just calmly played and timed away
Stokes to Clarke, no run touch shorter length and a touch wider, Clarke drives loosely at it and gets an inside edge to midwicket
Stokes to Clarke, no run good length on the stumps, Clarke defending back and across the off stick
Bopara to Watson, no run touch wider, driven at, didn't time it and finds point
Bopara to Watson, 1 run full on off stump, clipped out to deep midwicket
Bopara to Clarke, no run little shimmy down the wicket and gets an inside edge pushing forward to short long leg
Bopara to Clarke, 1 run full just outside off, driven with a large bottom hand steer out to deep cover
Bopara to Watson, FOUR runs flicked right across the front pad but gets enough bat on it and steers it fine of the 45
Bopara to Watson, no run shaped to pull for a moment then realised it was a touch full a foot outside off, ended up steering it to point
Tredwell to Clarke, no run around the wicket on the stumps, blocked covering up
Tredwell to Clarke, no run floated up, Clarke skipped out to it and ran it back to the bowler
Tredwell to Clarke, 1 run step down again and this is clipped with the spin to deep midwicket
Tredwell to Watson, 1 run over the wicket to Watson, fourth-stump line, paddle swept out to deep square leg
Tredwell to Clarke, 1 run shimmy down and clip out to deep midwicket
Tredwell to Watson, no run thought of coming down, then tried to rock back and cut a ball a foot outside off, ended up missing
Bopara to Clarke, 1 run length ball wide enough of off stump to steer to the sweeper
Bopara to Watson, no run fuller and straighter, forward press to extra cover
Bopara to Watson, 1 run full and this time driven firmly to extra-cover who slides and parries - Root in there - they go on the misfield
Bopara to Clarke, no run step across the off stump and tried to push a length ball into the on side, finds mid-on
Bopara to Clarke, 1 run length just outside off, Clarke stays leg side of it and pushes firmly to deep cover
Bopara to Watson, no run forward on off stump, pushed carefully back to the bowler
Tredwell to Clarke, 1 run down the track and tries to go hard into the on side, midwicket half saves and they get a single out to long on

Tredwell to Watson, FOUR runs tight off stump line, Watson is right back on his stumps and giving himself a little room to late cut down to third man, Pietersen in pursuit and they'll check the save, think it's four, foot in contact when he dragged the ball back
Tredwell to Watson, 1 run forward on off stump, clipped with the spin to deep midwicket and that's a nice fifty for Watson, good pace and keeping Australia going well
Tredwell to Clarke, 1 run skip down to the pitch and ran down to long on
Tredwell to Watson, SIX runs Watson steps down now and a big swing over long-on, nailed it
Tredwell to Watson, FOUR runs now swing wide of long-on, nailed it again and that's a one bounce four, powerful strike
Bopara to Clarke, 1 run length on off stump, tucked in front of square leg for a single

Bopara to Watson, SIX runs touch short and pulled hard, who's out at deep midwicket? Jordan is but he's just too short with the jump to take the catch, it went flat and hard and just cleared the rope. Jordan was a few pace in off the rope because it's a big boundary out there
Bopara to Watson, no run forward and dabbing to point from just outside off
Bopara to Watson, 2 runs full delivery driven, a thick outside edge runs where third slip might have been, Carberry scrambled well at third man
Bopara to Watson, 2 runs forward and opens the face down to third man again, they run very hard and get two, excellent running that is, home easily in the end, throw was a bit high of Buttler
Bopara to Watson, 1 run Carberry in the game again, this time comfortably picking up and conceding just a single
Tredwell to Watson, no run around the wicket to Watson now too, floated up a little, flicked from off stump to midwicket
Tredwell to Watson, no run touch flatter, ran to midwicket again with the spin
Tredwell to Watson, 1 run shimmy out of his ground and this time pushes down to long on
Tredwell to Clarke, no run flat delivery, Clarke stands in the crease and blocks
Tredwell to Clarke, 1 run shifts back, lets the delivery slide towards off stump and late cuts backward of point
Tredwell to Watson, SIX runs chances his arm down the ground and...six more! Easily clears Joe Root and the 100 partnership is suddenly up, Watson on fire
Bopara to Clarke, no run off stump on a length, blocked up the wicket
Bopara to Clarke, no run step across the stumps and takes a length ball from outside off to midwicket
Bopara to Clarke, no run fuller on off stump, firm drive to the bowler's left hand
Bopara to Clarke, 1 run Buttler up to the stumps, tucked from on the stumps wide of midwicket for a quick single
Bopara to Watson, 1 run wider on the crease, played forward on off stump, thick edge down to third man
Bopara to Clarke, 1 run just short enough to pull and finds deep midwicket
Tredwell to Clarke, no run step down and pushes up to midwicket
Tredwell to Clarke, 3 runs step down again, gives himself room and drives wide of extra-cover, long chase for long-off who flicks the ball back and they get three
Tredwell to Watson, 1 run floated up on middle, big stride down, tucks through the gap at square leg
Tredwell to Clarke, FOUR runs swept firmly off the stumps, well connected and gets it backward of square, four more
Tredwell to Clarke, 1 run length ball patted through midwicket, thoughts of two are rejected and there's nearly a mix up
Tredwell to Watson, 1 run flat hard delivery outside off, pulled firmly out to long-on
Bopara to Watson, 1 run forward on the stump and pushed firmly out to long on
Bopara to Clarke, FOUR runs full length wide enough of off stump to allow Clarke to lift it up and over extra-cover, timing is lovely
Bopara to Clarke, no run similar line, can only find mid-off with the drive this time
Bopara to Clarke, no run drags the length back a bit, clipped with the angle to the leg side 45
Bopara to Clarke, FOUR runs this time beats the leg side 45, line was too straight from Bopara and Clarke flicks it away merrily
Bopara to Clarke, no run length ball just outside off, pushed forward and ran to point
Root to Watson, 1 run around the wicket, flat just outside off, forward and dropped in front of backward point for a sharp single
Root to Clarke, no run step down the track and clip to midwicket from middle stump
Root to Clarke, 1 run floated up on leg stump, clipped through square leg, backward square is in quickly to save the second and Clarke's fifty comes up, back holding up okay
Root to Watson, 1 wide flat down leg side, flicked at and missed
Root to Watson, 2 runs middle and leg line, clipped inbetween deep backward square and deep midwicket, they get a couple with good running
Root to Watson, no run forward just outside off to push to extra-cover

Root to Watson, FOUR runs step back and pulled into the deep, can Stokes get around to save four on the midwicket rope? He jumps over the rope and pats it back but unfortunately had his foot grounded over the rope when flicking it back, almost a great save
Bopara to Clarke, FOUR runs length ball on off stump, Clarke gets across his stumps and flicks with the angle backward of square and beats the deep fielder, excellent placement
Bopara to Clarke, no run full just outside off, pushed up to extra-cover
Bopara to Clarke, FOUR runs poor line and flicked fine for four, simple leg glance
Bopara to Clarke, 1 run length on off stump, clipped out through midwicket from the crease
Bopara to Watson, no run length on off stump, Watson plays from the crease and tucks to midwicket
Bopara to Watson, no run hint of width outside off and cut hard, got his wrists through that stroke quickly but a fabulous diving save at backward point keeps it to a dot
Stokes to Clarke, FOUR runs length ball, Clarke steps to leg and heaves it away through square leg, enough bat on that to beat the deep fielder running to his left
Stokes to Clarke, 3 runs now a full toss on middle, clipped through midwicket and three more
Stokes to Watson, no run length ball, a little straight with no long leg back, Watson tucks it to the man in the ring
Stokes to Watson, 1 run fuller line and a front-foot push to midwicket
Stokes to Clarke, FOUR runs full delivery just wide of off stump, driven firmly and times it well, guiding it wide of mid-off, Rankin can't get down to it and it races away from him, 150 stand up
Stokes to Clarke, 1 run full on the stumps, clipped out to deep square leg
Rankin to Clarke, no run just back of a length outside off, Clarke goes to late cut and misses, bounced a bit on him
Rankin to Clarke, no run pulls this from a similar line, gets it off the toe to mid-on
Rankin to Clarke, no run oh lovely, great length around off stump, it bounces again and beats Clarke's dab aimed at cover
Rankin to Clarke, no run touch fuller, Clarke just blocks around off stump up the wicket
Rankin to Clarke, 1 run touch wider of off stump allowing Clarke to guide down to third man
Rankin to Watson, no run full length draws Watson forward, he plays at it and gets beaten outside off, nicely bowled

Jordan to Clarke, 1 run full on off stump, slapped hard clearing the front leg, Rankin at mid-off, straight to him, it bursts through his hands above head height and he can't grab it tumbling backward, big miss, should definitely have been taken
Jordan to Watson, 1 run full on off stump, pushed from off stump up towards mid-on and they steal a single
Jordan to Clarke, no run full length angled into the body, Clarke blocks it in the crease, trying to give himself a little room is Clarke
Jordan to Clarke, 4 leg byes poor line and it runs off the thigh guard to fine leg, trying to tuck the batsman up and overdid it
Jordan to Clarke, 2 runs off stump on a full length, struck up and over the infield, not perfectly timed but enough club to clear mid-off and extra-cover running back

Jordan to Clarke, OUT another chance to mid-off, Pietersen's there this time and takes the catch as Clarke splices a pull stroke. Tried to open up the off side again did Clarke but didn't become a great position from which to play a pull stroke, perhaps got hurried by Jordan and got nowhere near enough on the stroke and it looped to Pietersen who showed Rankin how to do it
Rankin to Watson, no run full and well wide of off stump, Watson leaves it alone
Rankin to Watson, 2 runs same line, this time Watson plays and clips it out to third man, wide enough of the fielder for a couple
Rankin to Watson, 1 run slightly tighter line and late cut off an underedge, it bounces wide of slip and they get a single
Rankin to Bailey, no run full length two feet wide of off stump, left alone
Rankin to Bailey, no run similar line a touch fuller, shoulders arms again
Rankin to Bailey, no run plays at this, also just outside off stump, dabbed into the covers
Jordan to Watson, 1 run full just outside off, Watson leans back in the crease and opens the face to get it to third man
Jordan to Bailey, no run length ball, well wide of off stump, Bailey goes to cut and misses, scurried through a little low that
Jordan to Bailey, no run straighter line and goes to flick through the leg side and gets struck on the pad
Jordan to Bailey, no run full ball a foot outside off, didn't really use the feet well enough and mistimed a drive to extra-cover
Jordan to Bailey, no run full ball on off stump, Bailey just blocking in the crease
Jordan to Bailey, 1 run too straight on a length, lucky to only be flicked to long leg
Bopara to Bailey, no run length ball, comes forward and pushes to mid-on
Bopara to Bailey, no run outside the line of off, goes back and cuts the ball to point
Bopara to Bailey, 1 run drops a little short, pulled in front of square to the fielder on the fence
Bopara to Watson, 1 run driven back, Bopara despairingly tries to get a fingertip on it but fails, the ball hits the stumps at the non-striker's end and deflects between two fielders
Bopara to Bailey, 2 runs worked through square leg and they get back for a comfortable two
Bopara to Bailey, no run comes forward and taps straight to a fielder at extra cover
Root to Watson, 1 run tossed up from round the wicket, pushed wide of the bowler and Root can't quite prevent one

Root to Bailey, OUT Bailey sweeps and misses, Buttler nudges off the bails and trots away to celebrate with Root - he seems pretty certain but the umpires send it upstairs to check. And the evidence is pretty clear, Bailey's foot stayed grounded just beyond his crease, he made no effort to get it back, so must have lost his bearings... This is going to be out, Root has done the trick, in slightly bizarre circumstances
Root to Voges, 1 run tossed up on leg stump, worked through midwicket for one to get going
Root to Watson, 1 run darted through on the stumps, fiddled behind square on the leg side
Root to Voges, 1 run stays leg side, Voges comes forward and closes the face for another one through midwicket
Root to Watson, 1 run paddled through backward square, they think better of going for two, so Watson keeps the strike and remains on 99
Bopara to Watson, no run touch full and outside the line of off, leans into a drive to mid-off
Bopara to Watson, no run short of a length, this time Watson covers up in defence in front of the stumps
Bopara to Watson, no run tight line, on off stump, pushed back to the bowler
Bopara to Watson, no run goes across his stumps and works the ball short on the leg side
Bopara to Watson, 1 run bit of width this time and Watson is able to run a single through backward point - that's his century, Watson's eighth in ODIs and, from 87 balls, one of his rampaging best
Bopara to Voges, 1 run Voges gets forward and dabs into the covers, there's no run until the throw defeats Buttler and runs to backward square leg
Root to Voges, 1 run tossed up on the stumps, worked through square leg for one
Root to Watson, 1 run nudged off the pads for another single
Root to Voges, no run tossed up on leg stump, comes forward to drive but can't get it past Root
Root to Voges, no run on the stumps, defended
Root to Voges, no run leans out and blocks back to the bowler
Root to Voges, 1 run flat trajectory, darted in and clipped to midwicket, where a diving stop keeps them to one, just three off the over
Bopara to Voges, no run good length outside off, Voges leans out and pushes into the covers
Bopara to Voges, no run on the stumps, comes forward but can't pick a gap turning the ball to leg
Bopara to Voges, no run quite wide, skids through a touch low and Voges misses with a wild cut
Bopara to Voges, 1 run slightly overpitched and this is driven trough the covers to the sweeper in the deep
Bopara to Watson, 2 runs nicely placed, Watson opening the face and steering the ball through backward point, third man has to come in and they get two
Bopara to Watson, no run comes forward, pushed into the covers and well stopped
Root to Voges, no run tossed up on leg stump, pushed back down the track to the bowler
Root to Voges, no run floated up, can't get it away
Root to Voges, 1 run angled in, flat and a bit quicker, manages to nurdle the ball into a gap at midwicket
Root to Watson, no run fired in on the pads, clipped into the on side, stopped smartly at midwicket
Root to Watson, FOUR runs some release, full and on the pads, Watson is down on one knee to sweep fine, that'll run for a much-needed boundary

Root to Watson, FOUR runs Root takes some more tap, consecutive fours for Watson, who lofts a slog-sweep over the leg side, Carberry was running back from midwicket but had little chance of getting under it and the ball bounces away to the fence
Stokes to Voges, 1 run comes forward and drives on the up through point
Stokes to Watson, 1 run full and wide, Watson has to reach with a horizontal bat to poke one through the off side

Stokes to Voges, OUT edged and gone, caught at the wicket with Buttler plunging to his right! Bit of a nothing stroke from Voges, half forward and attempting a little push, the ball kissed the edge and just about carried through
Stokes to Faulkner, no run pitched up, around off stump, comes forward to block
Stokes to Faulkner, no run defended short on the off side, Faulkner calls one but Watson shakes his head immediately as point races in - could have been trouble there
Stokes to Faulkner, no run line and length in the channel, shoulders arms this time
Root to Watson, 1 run darted on leg stump, Watson leans out and clips a single to deep midwicket
Root to Faulkner, 1 run bit more air, angled across and pushed towards mid-off, they steal one
Root to Watson, no run tossed up, dips on off stump and Watson has to drop his bat on it
Root to Watson, 1 run drags this very short, outside the line of leg and nudged through square
Root to Faulkner, no run full and on the stumps, poked back to the bowler
Root to Faulkner, 1 run hustles through the over, length on leg stump and Faulkner clips a single through square leg
Stokes to Faulkner, no run fullish length outside off, Faulkner doesn't move his feet, swings hard and misses
Stokes to Faulkner, 1 run leans out and drives to the cover sweeper
Stokes to Watson, no run pitched up on off stump, drilled back down the track but Stokes gets something on it to take the pace off
Stokes to Watson, 1 run plants the front foot and heaves down the ground, on the bounce to the man stationed at long-on
Stokes to Faulkner, 1 run touch short of a length, outside the line and Faulkner jabs at it, gets a single to third man
Stokes to Watson, no run spots Watson coming forwards and fires the ball wide, within the tramlines though, beating the horizontal bat
Root to Faulkner, 1 run angled flat on leg stump from round the wicket, nudged through backward square
Root to Watson, SIX runs flat and on the stumps, Watson picks this up early, clears the front leg and crumps it straight back over the bowler's head, clearing the man at long-on
Root to Watson, FOUR runs full toss from Root, maybe slipped out of the hand and Watson swings hard across the line, not a clean connection but it sails towards deep backward square on the bounce
Root to Watson, SIX runs tossed up and planted into the stands at deep midwicket, this is murderous stuff, right out of the middle
Root to Watson, 1 wide fires this in down the leg side, Buttler's pads prevent worse
Root to Watson, SIX runs Watson is climbing into Root now, brutal hitting and he's undone about five overs of good work, launching another slog-sweep into the crowd... where it's caught

Root to Watson, FOUR runs goes over the wicket, another full toss and Watson swings across the line, carted away again, more height than distance this time but it bounces between deep midwicket and deep square and over the boundary
Stokes to Faulkner, no run digs this in short, Faulkner springs back and blocks
Stokes to Faulkner, 1 run gets forward to a length ball and pushes through the covers
Stokes to Watson, 2 runs outside the line of off, steers a drive wide of the sweeper in the deep and they get back for two

Stokes to Watson, OUT steps away, swings the arms ... and nicks off! There'll be a few sighs of relief on the England balcony, as Watson was just threatening to take the game away again. He was looking to hit down the ground here but it wasn't quite full enough, Watson played down slightly the wrong line, small deflection and comfortably held
Stokes to Johnson, 2 runs leg-stump line, closes the face and works a couple through midwicket

Stokes to Johnson, OUT tries to turn to leg again, leading edge and gone, caught and bowled! Stokes has five-for! Johnson departs with alacrity, having made just a couple, and England have now claimed 5 for 73 in 13 overs (which would look a whole lot better without that Watson assault on Root)
Jordan to Faulkner, 1 wide starts with a loosener down the leg side
Jordan to Faulkner, 1 run short of a length, waits on it and drops one into the off side
Jordan to McKay, no run outside the line of off, shaping back and left alone
Jordan to McKay, no run gets across and taps a length ball square on the off side
Jordan to McKay, no run good line and length in the channel, McKay is determined to hang around for a bit, leaves again
Jordan to McKay, no run hangs his bat out unsuccessfully this time, beaten
Jordan to McKay, no run on the stumps, length ball, McKay pushes towards mid-on from the crease
Stokes to Faulkner, 1 run slightly full and tailing back in towards off stump, Faulkner squeezes it off the inside half of the bat
Stokes to McKay, no run testing length from Stokes, the batsman can't get forward and ends up pushing unsuccessfully from the crease as the ball zips through
Stokes to McKay, no run hangs back and defends in front of the stumps
Stokes to McKay, 1 run short and at the man, McKay hooks in slightly ungainly fashion and gets one through square
Stokes to Faulkner, 2 runs bit of width, Faulkner guides it into a gap behind point and thy get back for two
Stokes to Faulkner, no run tight line on off stump, Faulkner continues to play with restraint and defends
Rankin to McKay, 2 runs short and pulled, in the air towards midwicket, Carberry doesn't pick it up and they get a couple
Rankin to McKay, no run comes forward on the drive, not sure if that was a bump ball or straight off the bat but it clears the bowler and drops short of mid-off
Rankin to McKay, no run lovely ball, too good for McKay, who swings wildly and misses
Rankin to McKay, no run shuffles across his stumps, tries to play to leg and gets a leading edge
Rankin to McKay, no run beaten again, another jaffa from Rankin, seaming and bouncing as McKay plays inside it, more through luck than judgement
Rankin to McKay, 1 run nurdles to midwicket, McKay wants two but won't get a second, meaning he keeps the strike
Jordan to McKay, 1 run bit of width, McKay hangs the bat out and takes a single to the cover sweeper
Jordan to Faulkner, no run length delivery outside off, tries to run the ball behind point but picks out the fielder
Jordan to Faulkner, no run edges forward, dabs into the off side and Jordan fields

Jordan to Faulkner, OUT slightly back of a length and darting across Faulkner, Buttler throws himself down the leg side to take a sharp catch - was there a bit of glove on that? Umpire Dar thinks so but Faulkner immediately reviews. He thinks it flicked his sweater - and it did, but not before tickling the inside edge of the bat, Hot Spot clearly shows the mark and the decision is upheld. England have another
Jordan to Fawad, no run dug in short and at Fawad's bonce, he manages to jerk out of the way
Jordan to Fawad, FOUR runs shot! Jordan went full and straight but it was more half-volley than yorker and Fawad stepped away, crunched a drive past mid-off for four

Rankin to McKay, OUT McKay steps to leg, Rankin follows him and the slog across the line goes up in the air, to be safely pouched by the man coming in from deep square leg! Boyd Rankin, the pick of the attack, has a wicket at last and Australia have been bowled out for less than 300

6.05pm: Er, so how do you sum up that innings? It was helter skelter stuff, another very good Ageas Bowl pitch but Australia looked like they were going to easily get 350 at one stage; England will be delighted to have kept the target below 300, though 299 will still be a record chase here. Ben Stokes was the major beneficiary of Australia's bout of motion sickness but, spinners aside, the bowlers gave a decent account of themselves. We'll find out soon enough whether Shane Watson's (almost)

Welcome back everyone, final knockings of the international summer. Gone quickly hasn't it? Seems just a second ago I was sat here introducing New Zealand. Time flies and the players are on their way out for the last time in 2013 and England need 299 to take the series after a spirited fightback with the ball.

Michael Carberry will be hoping for a few on his home ground. He'll be feeling much better after his half-century in Cardiff. Kevin Pietersen is yet to fire in this series, can he do so here on what is a cracking deck. Hat-trick hero from Cardiff, Clint McKay, to bowl from the Northern End...
McKay to Carberry, no run forward on off stump to block into the cover, McKay right back on it
McKay to Carberry, no run good length a little wider of off stump, sliding across Carberry who drags his bat inside the line
McKay to Carberry, 1 run touch short and a touch straight, clipped wide of short long leg and they run a quick single to get the chase underway
McKay to Carberry, no run length ball outside off, Carberry watches it go past him
McKay to Carberry, no run full delivery wide enough of off stump to leave alone again
Johnson to Root, 1 run back of a length, played from the crease, gets a thick inside edge down to long leg
Johnson to Carberry, no run good length in the channel just outside off, Carberry plays inside the line
Johnson to Carberry, no run shorter but wide enough to leave again
Johnson to Carberry, no run left again outside off
Johnson to Carberry, 1 run angled in towards the pad, played forward and pushed into mideicket for a quick single
Johnson to Root, no run back of a length on off stump, Root drops it into the covers
McKay to Carberry, no run full length on off stump, very full in fact, dug out to cover
McKay to Carberry, 1 run good stride out from off stump and opens the face to guide a length ball down to third man
McKay to Root, 1 run full on middle and leg, dropped into midwicket and they get a quick single
McKay to Carberry, FOUR runs too close to leg stump and it's clipped very fine, well out of the reach of Wade
McKay to Carberry, no run goes to cut a ball too close for the stroke and gets an underedge towards point
McKay to Carberry, no run length on off stump, blocked in the crease
Johnson to Root, 2 runs back of a length outside off, forced off the back foot wide of third man and they can come back for a comfortable second
Johnson to Root, no run straight length ball, blocked up the wicket
Johnson to Root, no run touch fuller on off stump, played back again and dabbed towards cover
Johnson to Root, no run length delivery on off now, taken with the angle and ran out towards point
Johnson to Root, no run nicely bowled, slips past the outside edge with Root poking out from the crease, no foot movement there
Johnson to Root, no run short outside off and Root beaten for pace in missing the cut stroke
McKay to Carberry, FOUR runs full wide of off stump, Carberry drive at it and gets a thick outside edge, Finch dives to his left at second slip but can only get a fingertip to it, close

McKay to Carberry, FOUR runs another edge and this time it's through the keeper and first slip, that was Wade's catch down low to his left but he simply failed to go for it in time, Watson didn't really have a chance to take that, would have had to come a long way across
McKay to Carberry, no run length on off and this time off a meatier part of the bat to point
McKay to Carberry, 2 runs drives again and runs it through the covers, not timed at all well but it runs away from cover for two
McKay to Carberry, no run goes to pull and misses from off stump, gets hit on the body and it runs to slip
McKay to Carberry, 1 run pulls again, this time gets it high on the bat through square leg and they get a single
Johnson to Carberry, 1 leg bye full on leg stump, runs off the boot through square leg
Johnson to Root, 1 run full on off stump, just gently pushed into the covers, might have driven that away
Johnson to Carberry, no run forward on off stump and push a length ball up the wicket
Johnson to Carberry, no run two feet wide of off stump, left alone
Johnson to Carberry, no run short outside off, Carberry lets it past
Johnson to Carberry, 1 run full on the stumps, pushed wide of mid-on with the angle and they jog an easy single
McKay to Carberry, no run length ball that leaps a little on Carberry playing from the crease around middle, gets a glove to short long leg
McKay to Carberry, no run wide enough line outside off to cut, totally mistimes it to point
McKay to Carberry, FOUR runs full in the slot to drive just outside off, Carberry flashes the blade through the line and times it pretty well past mid-off
McKay to Carberry, 1 run tighter line and a shorter line, Carberry dabs from the crease backward of point for a quick single
McKay to Root, no run good length on off stump, Root dabs it into the covers from the crease
McKay to Root, no run length three feet wide of off stump, left alone
Johnson to Carberry, 1 run good length on off stump, guided into the covers with an angled bat
Johnson to Root, no run short and wide and cut straight to Clarke at backward point, missed out badly there, Root looks short of confidence
Johnson to Root, no run full length on middle and leg, played half-forward and ran back up the wicket
Johnson to Root, no run just back of a length ball sliding across Root who aims a back foot drive at it and misses
Johnson to Root, 1 wide very full and very wide and there's nothing the British crowd love more from an opposition player than a Mitchell Johnson wide
Johnson to Root, 3 runs aims another forcing stroke off the back foot and this time Root gets it through the covers, they run hard as extra-cover chases back and get three
Johnson to Carberry, 1 run length ball a foot wide of off stump, Carberry stays leg side of it and dabs backward of point and Root is through in a flash for a quick single
McKay to Carberry, no run full length just outside off stump, driven firmly up to mid-off
McKay to Carberry, no run full on off stump, Carberry forward playing with bat and pad together to push up the wicket
McKay to Carberry, no run took a step down the wicket and went for the cut but didn't get inside the line sufficiently and could only force to point
McKay to Carberry, no run does the same thing, this time finding extra-cover, getting it off the splice again
McKay to Carberry, no run length ball that Carberry stays in the crease to and tries to cut hard, misses
McKay to Carberry, no run full just outside off, driven without timing to mid-on
Johnson to Root, no run full and wide of off stump, driven and the footwork was poor so Root missed
Johnson to Root, 1 run touch shorter length, Root stays in the crease and angles it down to third man
Johnson to Carberry, no run bumper, well-directed and Carberry ducks well
Johnson to Carberry, no run good length on a fourth-stump line, well left
Johnson to Carberry, no run back of a length wide enough to cut, it bounces a little and beats Carberry's cut stroke
Johnson to Carberry, no run fuller length, played forward and knocked into the cover from off stump
Faulkner to Root, 1 run full on the pads and clipped out to deep midwicket
Faulkner to Carberry, 1 run room to cut outside off and finds the sweeper
Faulkner to Root, 1 run forward just outside off and ran down to third man
Faulkner to Carberry, no run goes to pull and gets cramped up, getting a bottom edge into the body and it nearly runs back into the stumps
Faulkner to Carberry, no run forward press a long way outside off stump, plays and misses
Faulkner to Carberry, no run goes to pull from outside off and misses by a long way, just struggling a little is Carberry
Fawad to Root, no run length on off stump, back and pushed up the wicket
Fawad to Root, 1 run forward on off stump, ran into the covers and they take a quick single
Fawad to Carberry, 2 runs touch short and it skids on outside off, Carberry cuts in front of deep cover and they take two
Fawad to Carberry, no run goes again, this turns in a little and Carberry misses
Fawad to Carberry, 1 run fuller and dropped into point for a quick single
Fawad to Root, 3 runs paddle swept off the stumps, had to hit that and gets three very fine, it was well saved by Faulkner running round from deep square
Faulkner to Root, no run forward on a good length around off stump, drops it towards square leg but the bowler is up in time to save the single
Faulkner to Root, 2 runs touch straight and clipped wide of long leg for an easy couple
Faulkner to Root, 1 run cut off the toe, it runs fine but third man is fine and cuts off the boundary
Faulkner to Carberry, no run back of a length on off stump, blocked towards backward point

Faulkner to Carberry, OUT full and straight, wraps Carberry on the pads, huge cry for lbw, not out given but Clarke goes for the review. I reckon this is a good effort, Carberry got a long way down the pitch but it did look straight as he missed playing across it. No mark on Hot Spot and Hawk Eye has it crashing into middle stump, good review and Carberry is gone. He tried to shuffle across and create some angle for himself but missed. That he was down the track and possibly outside t
Faulkner to Morgan, no run length ball wide of off stump, left alone
Fawad to Root, 1 run floated up on middle and leg, played forward and dropped into midwicket for a quick single
Fawad to Morgan, no run blocked from the crease around off stump
Fawad to Morgan, FOUR runs down the track and a huge swipe gets a thick inside edge past leg stump and it races away from short long leg, very very lucky for Morgan
Fawad to Morgan, FOUR runs nails this though, tossed up on off stump and slog swept with good timing, gets it up and over midwicket, nicely struck
Fawad to Morgan, 2 runs midwicket is now back on the fence so Morgan can drop this into the leg side and run hard for two, good cricket
Fawad to Morgan, no run good length on off stump, blocked back up the wicket
Faulkner to Root, no run back of a length just outside off stump, dabbed from the crease to point
Faulkner to Root, no run forward on off stump and ran with the angle to point again
Faulkner to Root, no run straighter line and knocked back to the bowler on the front dog
Faulkner to Root, 2 runs step across the stumps and works a ball just back in length through midwicket, again all the man there are out so they can sprint back for a couple
Faulkner to Root, no run fuller length, a firm drive to extra-cover from off stump
Faulkner to Root, no run step across the stumps again and clips back to the bowler's right hand
Johnson to Morgan, no run back of a length wide of off stump, left alone
Johnson to Morgan, 1 run much fuller and driven to the right-hand side of mid-on whose dive misses the ball but mid-off is covering and saves the second
Johnson to Root, no run length delivery on the stumps, blocked back up towards the bowler
Johnson to Root, no run full on the stumps, a firm drive back to the bowler
Johnson to Wright, no run length delivery on off stump, Wright pushes it back up the wicket
Faulkner to Morgan, no run good length in the channel outside off and left alone

Faulkner to Morgan, FOUR runs they'll not abandon hope with this man at the crease, though, Morgan narrows the angle, punches firmly through the on side, beats mid-on and that will run away, excellent timing
Faulkner to Morgan, no run edged and dropped, Watson has shelled it at slip, diving to his right, it went in and then out. Faulkner looks pretty cheesed off
Faulkner to Morgan, no run tapped into the off side, no run
Faulkner to Bopara, no run sliding across the right-hander from over the wicket, left alone
Johnson to Morgan, no run gets forward, attempts to play across the line, runs back down the track
Johnson to Morgan, no run slightly back of a length, tucks off his hips and it loops into the air towards square leg before landing safely
Johnson to Morgan, 1 wide sliding down leg again, Morgan misses and called wide
Johnson to Morgan, no run short and well wide of the stumps, not tempted by this one
Johnson to Morgan, 2 runs full and drifting towards leg stump with Johnson's slingy action, clipped past square leg and they get a couple
Johnson to Morgan, no run dug in short, Morgan plays across the line and gets hits on the body coming down the wicket
Johnson to Morgan, no run length ball outside the line of off, defended
Faulkner to Bopara, no run angled across on a length, Bopara punches the ball into the covers
Faulkner to Bopara, no run pitched up and pushed back towards mid-off
Faulkner to Bopara, no run bit of width, Bopara drives wristily but the ball flies to extra cover on the bounce
Faulkner to Bopara, 2 runs on the legs, slightly short and paddled round the corner for a couple to fine leg
Faulkner to Bopara, 1 run slanted across the batsman, who opens the face and runs one down to third man
Faulkner to Morgan, 1 run short of a good length, around off stump and pulled through square leg as Morgan moves across
Johnson to Morgan, 1 run full length, on the stumps, nudged off the pads into a gap at midwicket
Johnson to Bopara, no run dug in short, at the man, swatted with a horizontal bat to square leg
Johnson to Bopara, no run short again, this is up at 91mph and spits off the deck at Bopara, who is hit on the glove and then gets a few words in his earhole from Johnson as a follow up
Johnson to Bopara, no run rolls the fingers over a length ball angled across outside off, Bopara lets it go
Johnson to Bopara, no run full and wide, almost a slingy low full toss, left again
Johnson to Bopara, 1 wide leg-side bumper, very leg side, I should say - wide
Johnson to Bopara, no run back of a length, outside the line of off, steered to point
McKay to Morgan, 1 run angled across on a length, punched on the up through the covers coming forwards
McKay to Bopara, 1 run waits and glides one off the face down to third man
McKay to Morgan, no run too close for Morgan to cut but he tries anyway and is beaten in the channel outside off
McKay to Morgan, no run touch full, outside the line, comes forward and taps into the covers
McKay to Morgan, 1 run takes the pace of a touch, Morgan dances forwards, waits and nudges one to leg
McKay to Bopara, 1 run length delivery wide of the stumps, runs another single behind square

Voges to Bopara, no run tossed up, pitching on off stump and sliding on with the arm, beats Bopara's prod and hits him on the back pad ... Aleem Dar thinks about it for a moment and then raises his finger. Bopara doesn't look very confident but decides to review and Hawk-Eye shows it going on to miss leg stump. Well, that looked like it would shave a bit timber but, no. Might have bounced too much, as well
Voges to Bopara, 1 run floated up wide of the stumps and Bopara goes down on one knee to hack the ball down the ground to long-off
Voges to Morgan, no run flat, straightening on the stumps, defended
Voges to Morgan, 1 run full and dipping on leg stump, pushed through mid-on
Voges to Bopara, no run tossed up around the line of off, gripping a touch, turned towards midwicket
Voges to Bopara, 1 leg bye looped up outside leg stump, Bopara sweeps and misses and it rolls behind square off the boot
McKay to Bopara, 1 run length delivery outside off, driven on the up through the covers to the sweeper
McKay to Morgan, 1 run leg side, slightly fuller, tucked off the pads
McKay to Bopara, 1 run Bopara comes down the pitch, the ball stops on him a little, maybe McKay saw him coming, and he adjusts to pull through midwicket
McKay to Morgan, 1 leg bye McKay appeals as Morgan is hit on the pad, it was too high, off the thigh and runs away towards point
McKay to Bopara, 1 run comes forward and drops short on the off side, they pinch one more
McKay to Morgan, no run beats the bat, a cutter from McKay and it jumps off a length, Morgan does well to drop pull out and let it through
Voges to Bopara, 1 leg bye very full and leg side, again Bopara can't connect with a sweep
Voges to Morgan, 1 wide drags this down the leg side
Voges to Morgan, 2 runs straighter and straightening, nudged into a leg-side gap, deep midwicket has to trundle in and they get two
Voges to Morgan, 2 runs tossed up and again worked into the on side, soft hands and comfortably a couple more
Voges to Morgan, 1 run well outside leg, length delivery tucked behind square
Voges to Bopara, 3 runs Bopara steps away, Voges floats it up outside off and Bopara moves back across his stumps, opens the face and runs the ball delicately through backward point
Voges to Morgan, 1 run down the leg side, flicked fine off the pads
Watson to Morgan, no run bit if width, pushed across on a length, Morgan mistimes a cut
Watson to Morgan, no run pitched up on leg stump, turned to midwicket
Watson to Morgan, no run rolls his fingers over the ball, Morgan watches it out of the hand, tries to dab it down square on the off side but is sent back
Watson to Morgan, 1 run length ball slanted across the left-hander, who drives to the cover sweeper
Watson to Bopara, 2 runs little bit short, on the stumps and Bopara tucks it off his pads, into a gap and they get two more
Watson to Bopara, no run tight line on middle and off, tapped to leg
Voges to Buttler, 1 run Buttler comes forward to his first ball and drives slightly aerially into the off side
Voges to Bopara, 1 run driven down the ground to long-off
Voges to Buttler, no run floated up outside off, pushed back towards the bowler

Voges to Buttler, FOUR runs drops a little short and Buttler shows just how powerfully he can hit the ball, throwing his hands through a cut shot, terrific bat speed and it beats the dive of deep cover to find the rope
Voges to Buttler, no run outside off, leans out and taps back, Voges fields down to his left
Fawad to Bopara, 1 run looped up outside off stump, leans out to push through the covers
Fawad to Buttler, 1 run drives one more through the covers
Fawad to Bopara, no run tries to work the ball behind point, quick work ensures Bopara has to regain his ground sharpish
Fawad to Bopara, 1 run drops a little short and Bopara pulls firmly through midwicket but there's a man out there
Fawad to Buttler, 1 run gets forward and drives firmly down the ground to long-off
Fawad to Bopara, 1 run pushes one back on the on side
Voges to Bopara, FOUR runs gives himself room again, and then when Voges follows him, Bopara sweeps hard and fine and picks up four
Voges to Bopara, 1 run tossed up outside the line of off, comes forward and taps one to long-off
Voges to Buttler, 1 run Buttler gets on the front foot and punches one more down the ground
Voges to Bopara, no run leans out to defend a length ball outside off
Voges to Bopara, 1 run floated up around off stump, tight line from Voges but he can't quite stop Bopara's drive
Voges to Buttler, no run pushed back to the bowler
Fawad to Bopara, FOUR runs drops short and this is well timed and well placed by Bopara, rolling the wrists on a pull through midwicket
Fawad to Bopara, 1 run gets forward and pushes the hands through a punchy drive, Fawad takes the pace off but they get one
Fawad to Buttler, 1 run reaching for the drive, it's in the air but wide of extra cover and there's another single to the sweeper
Fawad to Bopara, 1 run floated up on the stumps, worked back past the bowler and Bopara gets home as the throw comes in from mid-on
Fawad to Buttler, no run legbreak around off stump, tapped back
Fawad to Buttler, no run pushed through a bit quicker outside off, play and a misses from the batsman
Watson to Bopara, no run length ball, on the stumps, Bopara covers his stumps
Watson to Bopara, 1 run goes back and across and runs one down to third man
Watson to Buttler, 1 wide this slides down the leg side
Watson to Buttler, no run good length, around off stump and maybe cutting his fingers over it a touch, defended into the leg side
Watson to Buttler, no run pitched up, Buttler gets forward to drive but picks out mid-off
Watson to Buttler, 1 run drops back to a length ball outside the line of off and glides a single off the face
Watson to Bopara, 1 run on the stumps, Bopara waits for it in the crease, rolls the wrists and flicks a single through square
Faulkner to Bopara, 1 run over the wicket, slanted across the batsman, who uses the pace to run the ball to third man
Faulkner to Buttler, 2 runs nice hands from Buttler, who opens the face and steers a length ball behind point, it doesn't go straight to third man and they get back for two
Faulkner to Buttler, 1 run touch shorter, again dabbed behind square on the off side
Faulkner to Bopara, no run gets a stride in and punches a drive to the man at extra cover
Faulkner to Bopara, FOUR runs Bopara comes forward, this is an edge but it flies well of the keeper and runs very fine, another useful boundary

Faulkner to Bopara, 1 run Faulkner's Kiss-like, tongue-out appeal gets an airing as Bopara is hit on the knee pushing forwards, it was pad before bat but the umpire isn't interested. Clarke eventually declines to review and it's a good decision as the ball wasn't coming back enough to hit off stump
Watson to Bopara, no run length ball, whipped firmly to leg but there's a brilliant diving stop at midwicket and a decent throw at the stumps as Bopara returns to base too
Watson to Bopara, no run on the stumps, nudged to midwicket
Watson to Bopara, 1 run slightly full, outside off and driven towards mid-off, whose has to move in and field and they get one
Watson to Buttler, 1 run gets forward and dabs another single to the same part of the ground
Watson to Bopara, 1 run drops short and Bopara cracks a pull shot through square, that part of the ground is protected, though
Watson to Buttler, 1 bye Buttler pushes unsuccessfully outside off but the ball dips on Wade and bobbles away, they pick up a bye
Faulkner to Buttler, 1 run pitched up and worked into the on side for another quick single
Faulkner to Bopara, no run comes forward and drives a length ball to mid-off
Faulkner to Bopara, 1 run slightly short of a length, Bopara dabs one more behind point
Faulkner to Buttler, 1 run angled across, touch full and wide and Buttler's hands strike like a cobra to thrash the ball down the ground to long-off
Faulkner to Bopara, FOUR runs short, maybe a slower ball as well and Bopara toes the ball round the corner, well behind the man at deep square and that's a pick-me-up four for England
Faulkner to Bopara, no run short again, connects with a fierce pull but picks out the midwicket fielder
Watson to Buttler, FOUR runs strays down the leg side first ball, Buttler just give it a tap on the backside as it passes and that will be four more to fine leg - fifty partnership up, too
Watson to Buttler, 1 run good length outside off, comes forward this time and drops one into the covers
Watson to Bopara, no run takes the pace off, Bopara works the ball to midwicket
Watson to Bopara, 1 run in the channel, Bopara drops back and steers a single behind square
Watson to Buttler, no run another cutter, on the stumps, Buttler only succeeds in playing it down on to his boot and Watson runs down to field
Watson to Buttler, 1 run walks across his stumps, tucks one more through backward square
Fawad to Buttler, 1 run turns the ball through midwicket
Fawad to Bopara, 1 run drops a little short, Bopara rolls the wrists on a pull through the leg side
Fawad to Buttler, no run steps out and defends a regulation legbreak back to the bowler
Fawad to Buttler, 1 run slides this one on outside off, Buttler throws the hands through a cut shot
Fawad to Bopara, 2 runs floated up on middle and leg, nurdled into a gap at square leg and they run hard for two
Fawad to Bopara, 1 run touch short, spinning away and forced off the back foot in front of square to the sweeper - half-century for Bopara, but only half the job done, as yet
Watson to Bopara, no run full on the stumps, driven back to the bowler

Watson to Bopara, no run forward and dropped towards mid-on, Bailey hares in from midwicket and dives, picks up and throws the stumps down in a brilliant piece of work - again - Buttler has dived back in safely though. Third umpire Ravi has taken a few days to give it not out even though it was so obvious
Watson to Bopara, 1 run down the wicket and nails a cover drive but extra-cover gets down to his right and saves very well, Bopara creamed that
Watson to Buttler, 1 run back on his stumps and clipping a length ball just outside off backward of point for a sharp single
Watson to Bopara, 1 run length delivery on the stumps, Bopara clips through square leg, just a single available
Watson to Buttler, 1 run gently dropped towards point from the crease and they set off for a darting single
McKay to Buttler, 2 runs length on the stumps, dropped into midwicket and three men are back on the fence over there so they can charge back for the second
McKay to Buttler, 2 runs same again, gently dropped towards midwicket, McKay took off in pursuit himself but couldn't save the second
McKay to Buttler, 1 run this time Buttler has knocked it too close to deep square leg so just the one
McKay to Bopara, 1 run tried to pull off the front foot, didn't really time it and found deep square with a gentle roll
McKay to Buttler, FOUR runs ah lovely, brings out the ramp and pulls it off from outside off to fine leg
McKay to Buttler, 2 runs forward and knocked through square leg, deep backward square has to go to his left a long way and they get two again
Watson to Bopara, 2 runs steps to leg and cracks a drive wide of the cover sweeper, it was a comfy two even before the fielder slipped
Watson to Bopara, 2 runs tried to swing over the leg side, didn't really get it at all but a thick edge runs in front of square leg and they charge back for second
Watson to Bopara, 1 run backs to leg and aims through the off side, mistimed and finds extra cover
Watson to Buttler, FOUR runs touch full and Buttler is able to free his arms with a shimmy outside leg stump and nails the lofted drive, awesome timing over mid-off
Watson to Buttler, 1 run straight delivery and Buttler flicks down to long leg
Watson to Bopara, FOUR runs slower ball on the stumps and Bopara wheels it around the corner and beats short long leg
Faulkner to Stokes, 2 runs short of a length and pulled firmly through midwicket, wide of the sweeper so they get two
Faulkner to Stokes, no run back of a length just outside off, a firm back foot punch but finds cover
Faulkner to Stokes, no run finds the ring again with a firm back foot punch, it was there to hit with a little bit of width offered outside off

Faulkner to Stokes, no run forward just outside off stump, cry for lbw because it was played with bat and pad together, not out given by Bailey, Clarke goes for another review it was pad first but it looks outside the line, yep Hawk Eye has it striking Stokes comfortably outside the line of off stump, another decent decision from Rob Bailey
Faulkner to Stokes, no run played slightly across it but gets it back to the bowler who shies at the stumps and Wade is forced into a full-length dive to his right to save four overthrows

Johnson to Bopara, OUT steps to leg and slaps straight to extra cover and now England are dead. Bopara nailed it, creamed it right out of the meat of the bat but couldn't evade extra-cover who's taken a very sharp chance at head height with two hands, a cold night is not the time for those chances but that was very well held. Bopara can't believe it because he couldn't have timed that any better but he's got to go and two wickets at the start of spells have killed any hope England sti
Johnson to Jordan, no run back of a length just outside off, dabbed off the back foot into the covers
Johnson to Jordan, no run full length slides past the off stump with Jordan poking at it slightly
Johnson to Jordan, no run around the wicket, angled in, Jordan groping from the crease and getting beaten outside off again
Johnson to Jordan, no run tighter line and blocked in the crease up on the off side
Johnson to Jordan, no run fuller length, Jordan back on his stumps keeping it out up the pitch
Watson to Stokes, no run oh here we go again, Matthew Wade goes up on his own for a huge appeal for caught behind when Stokes's swing outside off stump missed by a long way
Watson to Stokes, 1 run length on the stumps, swung over square leg but the deep fielder in across quickly and saves the second
Watson to Jordan, 1 run length on the stumps, tucked into midwicket for just a single
Watson to Stokes, 1 run full just outside off, cracked through the covers where the sweeper fields, 200 up
Watson to Jordan, no run full length on off stump, blocked back up the wicket
Watson to Jordan, 1 run length ball wide of off stump, Jordan leans across and dabs it out through point
Fawad to Jordan, no run tossed up and spins one nicely past the outside edge
Fawad to Jordan, 1 run floated up nicely again, played forward and ran into the covers for a quick single
Fawad to Stokes, FOUR runs tossed up outside off, Stokes comes down and then has to lean a long way across to reach the ball but manages to drive it through the covers with decent timing
Fawad to Stokes, 1 leg bye down the wicket again, goes to flick to leg and gets struck on the pad
Fawad to Jordan, 1 run tossed up on the stumps, a drive past extra-cover
Fawad to Stokes, 1 run slapped with the spin from outside off to long-on
Watson to Stokes, no run full on off stump, tried to slug it over the leg side, mistimed it to midwicket
Watson to Stokes, 1 run down the wicket and slapped out to deep cover
Watson to Jordan, no run slower ball, 73mph, cut off a thick outside edge but it doesn't carry through to Wade
Watson to Jordan, 1 run another slower ball, this 75mph, right up in the blockhole, dug out down the ground
Watson to Stokes, 2 runs length ball on the stumps, heaved into the leg side, totally mistimed, slugs it into no man's heath between long-on and deep midwicket
Watson to Stokes, SIX runs but this is nailed and clears cow corner, got the front leg out of the way and swung right off the meat of the bat over the rope
Johnson to Jordan, no run short outside off, swung at and missed backing to leg
Johnson to Jordan, no run around the wicket cramping Jordan up, he blocks back up the wicket
Johnson to Jordan, 1 wide too far on the angle and a leg side wide
Johnson to Jordan, no run back over the wicket, stepped to leg but went too far, had to reach so far across to it and missed
Johnson to Jordan, no run good yorker on off stump, dug out back up the wicket
Johnson to Jordan, no run nicely bowled, full and right across Jordan who gropes at it and misses
Johnson to Jordan, 1 run full on the stumps, a thick edge from a prod forward gives a single to third man
McKay to Jordan, 1 run flicked from the body down to long leg
McKay to Stokes, 1 run low full toss, slapped down to long-on for just a single, Stokes is being starved of the strike
McKay to Jordan, FOUR runs leg side and Jordan hits is hard off the back foot through square leg and nails it for four
McKay to Jordan, 1 run clubbed leg side again, this is straight to midwicket
McKay to Stokes, no run full on off stump, Stokes tries to swing it into the golf course but gets a thick inside edge off his pad that nearly deflects back to the bowler
McKay to Stokes, FOUR runs down the track and hit hard down the ground, nicely timed this is and gets is straight of long off
Watson to Jordan, 1 run length ball just outside off, pushed to backward point
Watson to Stokes, no run goes to ramp but misses completed, it bypasses the off stump and Wade just about manages to stop it
Watson to Stokes, 1 run down the track and gets a toe towards long-on, just a single
Watson to Jordan, 1 run big swipe into the leg side, timed it quite well but deep midwicket can field easily
Watson to Stokes, 1 bye goes for the ramp again, misses again and this time Wade can't stop it so they take a bye as short third man goes back to field
Faulkner to Stokes, no run step to leg, good yorker just outside off and Stokes's drive misses
Faulkner to Stokes, 1 run another excellent yorker and digs it out down the ground, long-on does well, just a single and Tredwell comes back onto strike
Faulkner to Tredwell, 1 run back of a length on off stump, dabbed down to third man
Faulkner to Stokes, 2 runs step down and tried to clear the leg side, mistimed and ends up being a right hack of an inside edge through square leg, the fielder slips and concedes a second, poor Ahmed
Faulkner to Rankin, no run full on the off stump, driven back to the bowler
Fawad to Tredwell, FOUR runs oh shot of the day, a Lara-esque cover drive against the spin past extra-cover, timing was sublime
Fawad to Tredwell, no run tried to flick to leg and got cramped up and hit on the pad
Fawad to Tredwell, 1 bye tries the sweep and misses completely, it bounces over Wade'd glove
Fawad to Rankin, 2 runs flicked with the spin into the leg side, rolled between deep midwicket and long-on, they get back for two
Fawad to Rankin, 2 runs down the track and swung into the leg side, it's gone a mile up, in comes Finch from deep midwicket but he drops the catch he got there but spilled it

There we have it then, end of the series, end of the summer and Australia have won by 49 runs a pretty comprehensive victory in this final rubber. They have something to take home with them, it was a pretty torrid tour but in this NatWest series they have got themselves together nicely and played some decent stuff and deserved to take the series, albeit only over three matches. They take the series 2-1 with two easy wins here and in what was the first game at Old Trafford.

Today, for the third time this season, the visitors have enjoyed the conditions far better at the Ageas Bowl. A hard, flat wicket has served up plenty of runs and Shane Watson scored most of them. He was at his brutal best striking 12 fours and six sixes in 143 that motored Australia along having won the toss, Michael Clarke also played another tidy innings and even though they again collapsed at the end of the innings, 298 gave them plenty to bowl at.

And like at Old Trafford, England never threatened to chase down the target. Two calamitous run-outs hampered their cause and they had Michael Carberry and especially Joe Root looking out of touch and struggling to time the ball. It was Eoin Morgan once again that was required to get the chase going. He did but only for so long and Jos Buttler and Ravi Bopara, despite looking pretty good in cameos, had far too much to do. Mitchell Johnson, Clint McKay and James Faulkner were again excellent
Man of the Series goes to the winning Australian captain Michael Clarke, for his ton in Manchester and good showing today.

So that's all she wrote for the summer of 2013. It started with New Zealand causing an upset in the one-dayers before England flexed their muscles in the Tests. Then came the Champions Trophy that was cracking entertainment and a thrilling final between England and India that the hosts managed to throw away. But the big one was the Ashes, it wasn't vintage but we had four highly competitive matches and England won the moments when it mattered to take the Urn 3-0. Some T20 and one-day action

Less than a month until Australia are back in action, they get their one-day tour to India underway on October 10 with a T20 before seven ODIs. England have some time off before they travel down under for the return Ashes and the first Test gets underway on November 21 in Brisbane. That's the next time you'll hear from Monty and I, we're off for a well-deserved graze in the shires. See you soon...
Australia won by 49 runs
Player of the match is Shane Watson, AUS
